poem:
Title: The Cry of Stone 

Iron heart of Israel, stone-hewn,
Reverberates in chants of protest, raw, uncouth.
Faces lost in Gaza's gloom implore,
Within fortified ramparts, in places forlorn.

A thousand tongues demand an end to the play,
Echoing among Rafah's rubble-strewn way.
The northern bard hears their strife-ridden song,
In the distant echo of history's gong.
